column4: (joining in late, sorry if this has been covered) did you try to run the media-check on the same HW that you're having the trouble on? You say the MD5 is OK but scrolling sr0 errors sounds a lot like trouble reading the media. I'm thinking the CD or the drive is dodgy.
if the errors occur during boot-up (i.e. before you log on) then the "> file" trick probably won't work.
if the system gets as far as booting then "dmesg" wight bring the messages back. Failing that, check /var/log/messages
just to recap... the CD works with identical HW (at a friends place) but you get sr0 media errors when you try to use it on your system?

the only thing I can tink of is that your CD drive is dodgy. If the CD works at your friends place, and the HW is identical (i.e. no driver problems) then all that's left is the drive (or maybe RAM.... run the mem-checker?)
can you swap out the drive with another one? Can you BIOS boot off external CD Drive?
yes, this is latest DP45SG intel original motherboard ..
plus md5 signature i just checked matches, there is no issue with downloads what so ever, i think all these 7 cds that i labelled BAD are good too .. there seems to be some other issue here

how certain are you that the whole CD is readable from windows? can you run a checksum on it (no idea how to do that from windows...) Can you run RAM checker off the disk (just in case)? This is the MD5 checksum of the ISO file, not off the disk?
ya, the MD5 checksum is of the downloaded iso image which matches, and i have no idea how do the cd checking and ram checking thing [ i am a finance related guy :) ]
XP or vista? IIRC vista has a RAM-checker option from the boot-loader. Failing that, boot off the CD and choose the RAM checking option (let's hopt it gets tat far :-)
ubuntu one. I don't think that the XP install CD has a RAM checker (FWIW I think the vista one does)
RAM checker runs until you stop it. let it do at least one complete run, should take >> 10 mins
if ubuntu CD fails, maybe try ultimate boot cd: http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/
ya .. will run both and get back here
close to bed-time here, might not be here when you get back. Best of luck, welcome to Ubuntu!
